channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- EventPrime
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- EventPrime

item.title: CVE-2023-4251|2024-08-02T07:24:03.532Z -- unknown -- eventprime
item.description: The EventPrime WordPress plugin before 3.2.0 does not have CSRF checks when creating bookings, which could allow attackers to make logged in users create unwanted bookings via CSRF attacks.

item.title: CVE-2023-4250|2024-08-02T07:24:03.488Z -- unknown -- eventprime
item.description: The EventPrime WordPress plugin before 3.2.0 does not sanitise and escape some parameters before outputting them back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin.

item.title: CVE-2023-6447|2024-08-02T08:28:21.856Z -- unknown -- eventprime
item.description: The EventPrime WordPress plugin before 3.3.6 lacks authentication and authorization, allowing unauthenticated visitors to access private and password protected Events by guessing their numeric id/event name.

item.title: CVE-2023-4252|2024-08-02T07:24:04.271Z -- unknown -- eventprime
item.description: The EventPrime WordPress plugin through 3.2.9 specifies the price of a booking in the client request, allowing an attacker to purchase bookings without payment.

item.title: CVE-2023-5519|2024-08-02T07:59:44.783Z -- unknown -- eventprime
item.description: The EventPrime WordPress plugin before 3.2.0 does not have CSRF checks when creating bookings, which could allow attackers to make logged in users create unwanted bookings via CSRF attacks.

item.title: CVE-2023-5238|2024-08-02T07:52:08.541Z -- unknown -- eventprime
item.description: The EventPrime WordPress plugin before 3.2.0 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to an HTML Injection on the plugin in the search area of the website.
